metadata.text1:
- Stop any active bleeding
- Keep warm
- Support feeding
metadata.text3:
- Severe anaemia - paper white appearance
- Associated respiratory distress
- Signs of heart failure
- if infant symptomatic or underlying condition likely to benefit from increased Hb give transfusion

For acute blood loss: replace estimate loss

For more chronic anaemia (from multiple samples or anaemia of prematurity) use the formula: amount required (mls packed cells)= weight (kg) x desired increase in Hb x 3. 

10-15 ml/kg of packed cells is unlikely to go wrong. 

Rate: 5-10ml/kg/hour.

1ml/kg frusemide should be given one hour after the start or halfway through.
If >15ml/kg calculated volume, consider splitting over consecutive days especially if there is a PDA

Prescribe iron but not if the baby has high fever & sepsis - wait for acute infection to settle
